translation:
Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

Yesterday Cruz came and said that Bento Manuel went to Piratini and the artillery pieces to Rio Pardo, and Captain Augusto is at Triunfo with everything gathered, old men, children and the disabled, having 160 cavalrymen, 40 infantry under the command of Felisberto, Simas’ brother, and they say they will withdraw for these six or eight days; regarding the sending of the artillery pieces to Rio Pardo, this is confirmed by Corporal José João de Castro who was a prisoner in Rio Pardo and arrived yesterday from Santo Amaro; and Your Excellency Major Simas and Mombaque and, if willing, can also go to Oliveira’s men. Cruz is ready awaiting orders to proceed; this is what for now I have to inform Your Excellency.

God keep Your Excellency.  
Camp of Picada, November 18, 1838.  
Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Tomás José da Silva.  
Francisco Pedro de Abreu.  
Major Commander of the Detachment of Picada.

Mombaque is a corruption of Mombach.
